title: The Last Bite at the Blueberry Inn
premise: When a renowned food critic dies after eating a signature dish at her own inn, former forensic chef Elara Vance must prove the meal was poisoned and her own recipes weren't the murder weapon. As she investigates, she discovers the victim's upcoming tell-all memoir threatened to expose every corrupt secret in their picturesque Vermont town, turning the entire community into a suspect with a motive. Elara must sift through a stew of lies, using her palate to detect deadly ingredients and her instincts to uncover which friendly face is hiding a recipe for revenge.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a talented but disillusioned former forensic chef for the FBI who retreated to her hometown to run a quiet cooking school, only to be pulled back into a world of gastronomic crime.
conflict: Elara must solve the murder before the corrupt local sheriff pins it on her, all while racing against the publication of the victim's manuscript that could destroy countless lives—including her family's—and destabilize the town's fragile economy built on a facade of rustic charm.
setting: Present-day Maplecroft, a postcard-perfect Vermont town famed for its autumn foliage, artisan cheese, and annual Harvest Feast, where the glossy surface hides deep, decades-old fractures.
tone: Atmospheric and suspenseful with a warm, culinary core; a blend of cozy mystery comfort and sharp, page-turning tension, where the secrets are as carefully preserved as the town's prize-winning jams.
